steps.title: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains
steps.goal: Learn about Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains and understand: A forest is a top-level container of one or more domains sharing schema, configuration, and a global.
actions:
Read: Understanding the Active Directory Logical Model - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/identity/ad-ds/plan/understanding-the-active-directory-logical-model (5 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • A forest is a top-level container of one or more domains sharing schema, configuration, and a global catalog
   • Domains in the same forest are linked by automatic two-way, transitive trust relationships
   • A domain is a partition that stores user accounts, provides authentication, replication, and authorization data
Practice: Follow along with a basic Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains configuration example (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
steps.completion_check: Can explain Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains in your own words and completed the practice exercise
steps.subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains
subdomains_covered: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

steps.title: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory
steps.goal: Learn about Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory and understand: OUs let you delegate administration of user and computer objects to specific people or groups.
actions:
Read: Delegating Administration by Using OU Objects - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/identity/ad-ds/plan/delegating-administration-by-using-ou-objects (5 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • OUs let you delegate administration of user and computer objects to specific people or groups
   • Delegation: put admins in a group, place objects in an OU, then delegate OU tasks to that group
   • AD DS supports granular delegation: full control, create/delete/manage accounts, or only reset passwords
Practice: Follow along with a basic Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory configuration example (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
steps.completion_check: Can explain Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory in your own words and completed the practice exercise
steps.subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory
subdomains_covered: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

steps.title: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups
steps.goal: Learn about Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups and understand: cn is the group's Common-Name, its relative distinguished name, and must be unique among sibling obj.
actions:
Read: Group Objects - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/ad/group-objects (6 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • cn is the group's Common-Name, its relative distinguished name, and must be unique among sibling objects
   • member is a multi-valued attribute of DNs; items are linked references AD updates on move/rename
   • groupType is an integer bitmask indicating scope (domain local/global/universal) and security flag
Practice: Review a sample Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups policy and identify what it allows/denies (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
steps.completion_check: Can explain Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups in your own words and completed the practice exercise
steps.subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups
subdomains_covered: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

steps.title: Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management
steps.goal: Learn about Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management and understand: Security groups collect user accounts, computer accounts, and other groups into manageable units.
actions:
Read: Active Directory Security Groups - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/identity/ad-ds/manage/understand-security-groups (11 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • Security groups collect user accounts, computer accounts, and other groups into manageable units
   • Active Directory group types: Security groups and Distribution groups
   • Security groups assign permissions and user rights to resources and users
Practice: Follow along with a basic Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management configuration example (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
steps.completion_check: Can explain Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management in your own words and completed the practice exercise
steps.subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management
subdomains_covered: Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management

steps.title: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing
steps.goal: Learn about Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing and understand: Kerberos is an authentication protocol used to verify user or host identities in Windows domains.
actions:
Read: Kerberos authentication overview - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/security/kerberos/kerberos-authentication-overview (5 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • Kerberos is an authentication protocol used to verify user or host identities in Windows domains
   • Windows implements Kerberos V5 plus extensions for public-key authentication, authz data transport, and delegation
   • The Kerberos client is a Security Support Provider (SSP) accessed through the Security Support Provider Interface (SSPI)
Practice: Try 2-3 of the commands mentioned in the Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing documentation (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
steps.completion_check: Can explain Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing in your own words and completed the practice exercise
steps.subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing
subdomains_covered: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing

steps.title: BOSS: Active Directory Synthesis
steps.goal: Put your Active Directory knowledge together with a practical challenge.
actions: Quick review: Skim your notes from previous Active Directory days. What are the key concepts?
Mini-scenario: Design a simple AD structure for a company with 3 departments. Show: OUs, one GPO per department, and delegation for helpdesk
Self-assessment: What clicked? What's still fuzzy? What would you like to explore more?
steps.completion_check: Completed the Active Directory challenge and can connect different concepts together
steps.subdomain: Active Directory Sites, Subnets, and Replication Topology
subdomains_covered: Active Directory Sites, Subnets, and Replication Topology

evidence_packs.subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Understanding the Active Directory Logical Model
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the core components of the Active Directory logical model. It defines forests, domains, and organizational units (OUs) and how they form a hierarchical containment structure for network objects.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Active Directory Lab Setup (Part 1) - Forest Installation
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step tutorial on how to set up a complete Active Directory lab environment from scratch. This guide covers creating the forest root domain, which is a perfect hands-on exercise for understanding the foundational logical component of AD.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Forest, Tree, and Domain in Active Directory | Windows Server 2025
resources.description: A short, concise video tutorial that uses real-world analogies to explain the core logical structures of Active Directory: forests, trees, and domains. It's an excellent resource for beginners to quickly grasp these foundational concepts.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: AD DS Design and Planning
resources.description: A comprehensive guide from Microsoft for infrastructure specialists and system architects on how to design and plan an Active Directory Domain Services deployment. This resource covers designing the logical structure in depth.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

resources.title: Windows Server Administration Concepts: Active Directory
resources.description: This Pluralsight course provides a solid introduction to Active Directory concepts. It covers the different components of an AD infrastructure, how to manage organizational units, users, and groups, and how to centrally manage them using group policies.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Trees, and Domains

evidence_packs.subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

resources.title: Manage User Accounts with Active Directory Users and Computers in Windows Server
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation on how to create, delete, and manage user accounts and their properties, including group memberships and password management, using the Active Directory Users and Computers console.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

resources.title: Group Objects
resources.description: Detailed official documentation from Microsoft describing group objects in Active Directory. It covers important attributes like cn, member, groupType, and memberOf, as well as group types and scopes.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

resources.title: Active Directory Lab: Creating OUs, Users, Groups & Computers (Step-by-Step Tutorial)
resources.description: A step-by-step video tutorial that provides a hands-on lab experience for creating and managing essential Active Directory objects, including Organizational Units (OUs), users, security groups, and computer accounts using the ADUC console.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

resources.title: Create, manage, and delete users and groups in Active Directory
resources.description: A clear, step-by-step written tutorial that guides you through the process of creating, managing the properties of, and deleting user and group objects within Active Directory.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

resources.title: Active Directory Attributes List
resources.description: A reference guide that lists common Active Directory attributes with their friendly names (as seen in ADUC) and their actual attribute names (LDAP display names). This is useful for understanding the data stored for each object.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

evidence_packs.subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: Delegation of Control in AD DS on Windows Server
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the concept of delegation of control in Active Directory Domain Services. It covers why delegation is used, how it works with Organizational Units (OUs), and lists the common tasks that can be delegated using the Delegation of Control Wizard.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: Delegate Control in Active Directory (Step-by-Step Guide)
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step written tutorial with screenshots that walks through various scenarios for delegating control in Active Directory. It covers best practices for OU design and provides practical examples like delegating password resets and group membership modifications.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: 70-742 Lab 3, Creating and Managing Active Directory Groups and Organizational Units OUs
resources.description: A guided lab video that covers creating and managing OUs and groups. A key part of the lab is a hands-on exercise using the Delegation of Control Wizard to grant specific permissions to groups for managing objects within an OU.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: Delegating Administration by Using OU Objects
resources.description: This official Microsoft document explains the strategy of using Organizational Units (OUs) to delegate administration. It details how to structure OUs for delegation, the types of permissions that can be assigned, and the importance of not modifying default containers.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

resources.title: Creating, Managing, and Delegating OUs in Active Directory
resources.description: A concise video tutorial that demonstrates how to create, manage, and delete Organizational Units. It also provides a clear, practical walkthrough of using the Delegation of Control wizard to assign specific administrative tasks to a user for a particular OU.
resources.source_subdomain: Organizational Units and Delegation of Control in Active Directory

evidence_packs.subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management

resources.title: Active Directory Security Groups
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation detailing Active Directory security groups. It explains the two types of groups (Security and Distribution) and the three group scopes (Universal, Global, and Domain Local), providing a foundational understanding of how they work and are applied in a domain or forest.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management

resources.title: How to Create & Manage Active Directory Groups | Windows Server 2022
resources.description: A step-by-step video tutorial demonstrating how to create and manage groups in Active Directory using the 'Active Directory Users and Computers' tool on Windows Server 2022. The tutorial covers creating a new group, selecting its scope and type, adding members, and managing group properties.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management

resources.title: Managing Active Directory Groups with PowerShell: The Ultimate Guide
resources.description: A comprehensive, hands-on tutorial for managing Active Directory groups using PowerShell. It covers querying, creating, modifying, and deleting groups, as well as managing memberships. This guide is ideal for administrators looking to automate group management tasks.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management

resources.title: Group Objects in Active Directory Domain Services
resources.description: This official Microsoft reference document provides a technical breakdown of group objects in Active Directory. It details the attributes of a group object, and provides clear tables explaining group types and the rules governing group scopes, including membership and conversion possibilities.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management

resources.title: Scopes of Active Directory Groups
resources.description: A detailed video explanation of Active Directory group scopes (Domain Local, Global, and Universal). The video covers the purpose of each scope, how they interact, and demonstrates the creation and nesting of groups across a forest, including assigning permissions to a shared folder.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Types and Scope Management

evidence_packs.subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing

resources.title: Kerberos authentication overview
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the Kerberos version 5 authentication protocol implementation in Windows Server. It covers the benefits, practical applications like single sign-on (SSO) and delegation, and how it integrates with Active Directory Domain Services.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing

resources.title: Building a Beginner Friendly Hands-on Active Directory Lab
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step guide to building a complete Active Directory lab environment. The tutorial covers setting up a Domain Controller, client machines, and security tools. It includes sections on simulating and analyzing attacks like Kerberos ticket manipulation, providing practical, hands-on experience.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing

resources.title: How Kerberos Works in Windows Active Directory
resources.description: A concise written tutorial that explains the fundamental concepts of Kerberos authentication within an Active Directory context. It breaks down the ticket-granting process, including the roles of the Key Distribution Center (KDC), Ticket-Granting Tickets (TGTs), and service tickets.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing

resources.title: Kerberos Authentication Explained | A deep dive
resources.description: A detailed video that visually explains the entire Kerberos authentication process from start to finish. It covers the key components like the Authentication Server (AS), Ticket Granting Server (TGS), and the step-by-step exchange of tickets (AS-REQ, AS-REP, TGS-REQ, TGS-REP, AP-REQ, AP-REP).
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing

resources.title: Active Directory Authentication
resources.description: A comprehensive video course that provides a deep dive into Active Directory authentication mechanisms, with a strong focus on both NTLM and Kerberos. The course covers the inner workings of the protocols, their security weaknesses, and common attack techniques.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Kerberos Ticketing

evidence_packs.subdomain: Active Directory Sites, Subnets, and Replication Topology

resources.title: Active Directory Replication Concepts
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the core concepts of Active Directory replication. It covers connection objects, the Knowledge Consistency Checker (KCC), failover functionality, sites, subnets, and site links.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Sites, Subnets, and Replication Topology

resources.title: My Multi Site Ad Lab End To End
resources.description: A comprehensive, step-by-step guide to building a multi-site Active Directory lab from scratch. This tutorial covers creating sites, defining subnets, configuring inter-site transports, adding Read-Only Domain Controllers (RODCs), and testing replication.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Sites, Subnets, and Replication Topology

resources.title: Active Directory: Multi Site, Subnet, and Replication Configuration
resources.description: A detailed written tutorial that walks through the process of configuring a multi-site Active Directory environment. It covers renaming the default site, creating new sites and subnets, adding replication links, and configuring replication frequency and scheduling.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Sites, Subnets, and Replication Topology

resources.title: ADDS Sites and Subnets Deployment Explained with Demo
resources.description: A video tutorial that explains the concepts of AD DS sites and subnets and provides a step-by-step demonstration of their configuration in Windows Server. It covers creating sites, adding subnets, and setting up site links and replication schedules.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Sites, Subnets, and Replication Topology

resources.title: Active Directory Replication Topology Technical Reference
resources.description: A highly detailed technical reference from Microsoft on how the Active Directory replication topology works. Although for an older version of Windows Server, the core concepts remain highly relevant for understanding the underlying mechanics of replication.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Sites, Subnets, and Replication Topology
